lead_paragraph: PINES-- James M.,a lawyer, economist and international economic development consultant, died on January 10, 2016 in Chevy Chase, MD at the age of 89. He was the son of Samuel S. and Ruth Golden Pines. Pines grew up in Peekskill, NY, and earned a B.A. from Bard College, an M.A. from Harvard, and a law degree from Yale. Over more than three decades as a consultant on nutrition, food aid and program evaluation, Pines undertook assignments with the United States Agency for International Development, the World Bank, and non-governmental organizations in more than 60 countries. Pines' first marriage ended in divorce. Survivors include his companion of 30 years, Janet Lowenthal; his former wife, Caryl Pines Curry; two sisters, Joanne Pines Hersh and Doris Pines Markoff; a daughter, Eve Pines and a son, Roger Pines; son-in-law Richard Martinko; and grandchildren Reed and Irene Martinko. Memorial gifts may be made to JSSA Hospice, 6123 Montrose Rd., Rockville, MD 20852 and to the Robert White Human Rights Fund, Center for International Policy, 2000 M St., NW Washington, DC 20036. A Memorial Service will take place at 12pm on January 27, 2016, at the Wisconsin Place Community Center, 5311 Friendship Blvd., Chevy Chase, MD 20815. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  PINES, JAMES M.
